intro: Acrostichum incisum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fern, is a tropical plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are usually dark green and have a lanceolate shape with sharp, serrated edges. Acrostichum incisum is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
